body: - Fixes issue on Pixel 3/4 devices where adding a local passcode would not properly save data.

- Adds ability to change local passcode keyboard type from input screen.
- Fixes issue where adding a new passcode with a default keyboard type with previously deactivated numeric passcode would not retain default keyboard type preference.
- Underlying improvements to sync and conflict resolution engine.

- (iOS) Fixes issue where closing app with fingerprint set to immediate would sometimes flash the fingerprint authentication alert while closing.
- (Android) Fixes potential issue where pressing physical back then re-opening app may cause local authentication to not go through.

- Fixes issue from 3.0.6 where some Extended editors would not load.
- Fixes issue where link clicks in Extended editors opened pages inline. Link clicks via Extended editors will now open in your browser.
- Fixes issue where using Extended editors resulted in a slight jump when accessing toolbar options.
- Fixes issue where requiring all three authentication types (account password, local passcode, and Touch ID/Face ID) for a privileged action could result in no action on submit.

- Fixes issue where link clicks in Extended editors opened pages inline. Link clicks via Extended editors will now open in your browser.
- Fixes issue where using Extended editors resulted in a slight jump when accessing toolbar options.
- Fixes issue where requiring all three authentication types (account password, local passcode, and Touch ID/Face ID) for a privileged action could result in no action on submit.

- More clearly distinguishes mobile default editor. You can long press on an editor to choose to make it your default mobile editor.
- When an Extended editor fails to load (due to being offline), you'll now be able to use the plain editor right away, without having to switch
- (Android) Fixes issue where exporting local data backup saved in inaccessible location
- (iOS) Fixes issue where Extended editor content could be hidden behind keyboard.
- (iOS) Fixes issue on iPad where keyboard could block + button to add new note.

- More clearly distinguishes mobile default editor. You can long press on an editor to choose to make it your default mobile editor.
- When an Extended editor fails to load (due to being offline), you'll now be able to use the plain editor right away, without having to switch
- (Android) Fixes issue where exporting local data backup saved in inaccessible location
- (iOS) Fixes issue where Extended editor content could be hidden behind keyboard.
- (iOS) Fixes issue on iPad where keyboard could block + button to add new note.

- (Android) Adds ability to export data backups to email, in addition to saving to disk
- (Android) Fixes issue with having both local passcode and fingerprint, where double validating local passcode incorrectly triggered success state.

- Fixes issue where Unlock button would sometimes have no action.
- Most recent items are now loaded first on app launch, resulting in a smoother loading experience
- Fixes issue where text couldn't be selected on Locked notes
- Fixes issue where pressing hardware back button could result in inconsistent app state upon return

Standard Notes 3.0 features a refreshed interface, a smoother and more performant experience, and powerful features like Privileges.
Here's what's new:
- Privileges allow you to protect notes to require additional authentication to view or delete notes.
- An all new trash bin, where deleted notes are placed. Trashed notes can be recovered or deleted permanently.
- A cleaner and more polished UI, consistent with the desktop experience.
- The ability to set an editor as default by long-pressing it.
- Smart tags are now available on mobile, so if you've created any custom smart tags via the Folders extension, they'll now appear here.
- Reverse sorting option.
- Revamped Extended themes for smoother, thicker themes.
- Data backups can now be exported to other applications, instead of just an email attachment.

And lots, lots more improvements and fixes. We hope you enjoy this 3.0 update! Please be sure to also update Standard Notes on your desktop to version 3.0.3 for the most consistent cross-platform experience.

- Remove scrolling view for web editors. Now, your note will default to your web editor, if applicable. If you want to switch to the plain editor, press the tags button, then select "Use Plain" in the "Edit With" section.

- Added options to hide note previews, note tags, and note dates in list of notes.
- Extended editors now appear inline and not as a separate pop-up. Swipe horizontally to switch between the web editor and plain editor.
- Extended editors previews will now display cleaner previews (no raw markup). Requires at least one edit per note to trigger new previews. Be sure to use desktop version 2.3.9 as well.
- Fixes issue where returning to the app after long periods of time with fingerprint or passcode enabled could result in a blank screen.

- Offline users will now see their last export date in the Account menu. This is to remind offline users that it is their responsibility to keep regular backups of their data. Otherwise, you are encouraged to sign up for a free sync account to keep your data backed up automatically.
- Remove refresh control for non-signed in sessions
- On iOS, web editor cache is now cleared after every app update, rather than after every app launch. This will result in quicker loading times for web editor extensions.
- Fixes issue where navigating away from Compose while "Saving..." does not remove that text when you return.
- Search now dismisses the keyboard when you submit.
Fixes zombie note issue for existing notes (previous version just prevented the issue from happening)

- Fixes slow loading issue some users may have encountered.
- Fixes issue where exporting a decrypted archive would not work for some users.
- Fixes issue where removing a tag from an old note would not take effect.
- No longer updates the modified date of a note when locking or unlocking it.
Displays alert on expired session.

New in 2.2.1:
- Fixes issue with Simple Markdown Editor where selecting a tab option would cause a crash.

New in 2.2:
- Incremental loading makes app start up faster.
- Improved external editors load time.
- Fixes third party keyboards compatibility issues.
- Fixes issue where deleting notes while offline would not sync them after regaining connectivity.
- Fixes issue where choosing to export Decrypted backups would create an encrypted file.
- Introduces "Strict sign in" security option. Learn more at standardnotes.org/help/security.

- Incremental loading makes app start up faster.
- Improved external editors load time.
- Fixes issue where deleting notes while offline would not sync them after regaining connectivity.
- Fixes issue where choosing to export Decrypted backups would create an encrypted file.
- Introduces "Strict sign in" security option. Learn more at standardnotes.org/help/security.

- Fixes issue where creating a new note then pressing back without making changes would create an empty note.
- Fixes issue for possible race condition that occurs during sign in, where some data may be duplicated. If for some reason you still see this issue after this update, please email us directly with any relevant information: hello@standardnotes.org. As always, you can use the Batch Manager extension on desktop and web to automatically detect and clean duplicates.
